Judith a commencé la vente de tissus depuis onze (11) ans. Judith a une clientèle importante et elle pense diversifier son activité. Judith veut vendre en plus de tissus, des bijoux et colliers. C'est dans cette optique que Judith sollicite un crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Judith was born on June 10, 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. She traces her roots to DANGBO, a village of OUEME county in southern Benin. She has been divorced for eight years and has no children. Judith rents a place in Kowegbo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells rich damask fabrics. She is a seamstress by training, though she left this trade because it was no longer doing well for her. She started selling fabrics eleven years ago and has a sizable number of customers. She's thinking of diversifying her business. She wants to sell more fabrics, some jewelry, and necklaces. With this in mind, Judith is requesting a loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics (rich damask)

loans.name: Los Cantaritos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los cantaritos es un grupo conformado por socias del mercado D. la zona D. Muy Unido, este grupo es D. personas muy alegres. Entre las actividades que se desarrollan en el grupo sonvariadas, D. las cuales se pueden mencionar: venta D. verduras, frutas, desayunos, comidas, cosméticos, lácteos, venta en bazar, chapería, venta D. carne y salón D. peluquería.
A todo el grupo le vamuy bien ya que tiene  ubicaciones estratégicas. El crédito lo utilizarán para renovar mercadería e incrementar su capital D. operaciones. En si el grupo es D. socias muy responsables ya que cumplen con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The “Los Cantaritos” group is an association of very happy businesspeople from the market in the Muy Unido area. The activities of the group's members are varied, and incluD. selling vegetables, fruit, breakfast, food, cosmetics, meat, and dairy products, as well as running clothing stores, auto body repair shops, and beauty salons.

All of the businesses are doing very well as they are well-located. They will use this loan to replenish their merchandise and increase their working capital. This group is very responsible and punctual with loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zebra Juliet Madina Group

texts.en: Juliet M. is a single mother of four children, all of whom are going to school. She has been in her restaurant business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase food items for her restaurant, such as soft drinks, maize flour, rice, bananas, meat and chicken. Her dream is to make more money and to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Niaré un homme marié de 27 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme  et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Adama se lance dans le commerce. Il a fait la commercialisation des céréales pendant 4 ans au grand marché de Bougouni. Cette activité ne lui a pas réussie, c’est ainsi qu’il décida de commencer la vente des condiments alimentaires au même grand marché de Bougouni.
Avec 5 années d’expérience, Monsieur Adama Niaré maîtrise bien cette activité qu’il a appris auprès d’une  de ses sœurs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte acheter,  une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni en détail au comptant et à crédit à une  clientèle majoritairement  constituée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Niaré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
 Il envisage dans les années à venir ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Niaré is a married man, 27 years old, and the father of two. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After Koran school, he got started in commerce. He has been marketing grains for four years at the grand marketplace of Bougouni. This business wasn't successful, so he decided to begin selling condiments at the same marketplace. With five years of experience, he has a good command of this business, which he learned from one of his sisters. Concerned about satisfying his numerous customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan and intends to buy a sizable quantity of condiments of different types. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And sales are made retail at the same marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to mostly women customers. With this loan, Mr. Niaré intends to realize a monthly profit of 26,500 francs CFA that will be used to expand his enterprise and to meet his family's needs. He envisions opening a shop in the years to come.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase watermelon seedlings, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 25 años, es una madre muy amorosa y querida por su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 26 años y sus 2 hijos; Rosabel de 9 y Kevin de 5 años, quienes son su principal motivación. En Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar departamento de Puno), se encuentra la tienda de Elena, la cual por su proximidad a la plaza principal de la ciudad es muy concurrida, ella abre todos los días a las 6 de la mañana y siempre que entra un cliente a su tienda lo recibe con mucha cordialidad y una amplia sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al ser la administradora de su negocio, puede decidir qué horas trabajar y qué horas dedicarse a las tareas del hogar. Elena lleva 10 años atendiendo a la gente y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar trabajando duro para mejorar su vida. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su tienda crezca y se vuelva la principal de Nuñoa. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llega el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elena is 25. She is a very loving mother who is well loved by her family. She lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, who is 26; and her two children, Rosabel, who is 9; and Kevin, who is 5. Her children are her primary motivation. Her store is in Nuñoa (district in the Melgar province, Puno department), and it is very busy because of its proximity to the main plaza in the city. She opens every day at six in the morning. Every time a customer enters the store she greets them very cordially with a wide smile. What she likes the best about her work is that, as the administrator, she gets to decide what hours she works and what hours she does the housework. She has been waiting on people for ten years. What she considers the most difficult is having to stay in her store all day. Even so, she knows she needs to keep working hard to improve her live. In the near future she hopes that her store grows until it becomes the best in Nuñoa. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is always up to date with the agreements the group comes to in her Community Bank. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more products to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Ndevera is a member of the Muungano borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 36-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. Her children are ages 19, 16, 13, and 9.  

Ndevera started her own business selling soft drinks four years ago. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Ndevera’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 TSH in order to buy more drinks. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ndevera hopes to pay school fees, get more food, save money and expand her business. 

Bethania, another member of the Muungano borrower group, has also requested 250,000 TSH in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 25 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Vida is a trader. She trades in textiles, particularly underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Vida has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Irma Benita

texts.es: Doña Irma Es originarai de la comunidad de PAnquix su actividad principal es la agricultura ella viene realizando dicha actividad economica  desde hace quince años actividad que aprendio de su difunto padre en la venta de verduras y maiz sus principales puntos de ventas en la plaza de Totonicapan los dias sabados y martes y los dias domingo en San Cristobal Totonicapan hoy necesita de un credito  para remodelar su vivienda  para tener un hogar digno para poder vivir
texts.en:
Doña Irma is from the community of Panquix. For 15 years, she has worked in agriculture, which she learned from her deceased father. She sells vegetables and corn, and her principal points of sale are in the Plaza de Totonicapan on Saturdays and Tuesdays, and San Cristobal Totonicapan on Sundays. She currently needs a loan in order to remodel her house so that she has a decent home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu has been selling drinks and sachet water in wholesale and retail for long. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her family above poverty. She 49 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Delfina es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Delfina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza 3 veces por semana, además vende desayuno todos los días.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Delfina son mejorar su negocio y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the communal bank "Hormigas." She is married, 56 years old and has 4 children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she sells food; she does this three times a week and also sells breakfast every day. Delfina needs a loan of 1300 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Delfina dreams of improving her business and having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, pepper, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena N. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Lorena is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lorena sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Lorena's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.es:
L. UD. “Flamboyan” Ubicado en el Barrio San Sebastián Municipio D. Tecpatán Estado D. Chiapas, México. Integrada por 5 acreditadas. Dentro D. este grupo se encuentra L. señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, es originaria D. Tecpatán Mezcalapa Chiapas, dice: “tengo un nombre talvez no muy popular, pero me gusta, mis padres decidieron llamarme así en reposición D. una tía muy querida”. Tiene 38 años D. edad, solo estudió L. primaria, su esposo se llama Rigoberto Bautista Narváez y trabaja en una mueblería. Poseen 3 hijos quienes aun van a L. primaria del mismo municipio.

Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, se dedica a confeccionar ropa como son: pantalones, vestidos, faldas y blusas. DesD. hace 18 años, aprendió por medio D. unos cursos que le impartieron en su misma localidad. Hoy lo hace con gran orgullo por que ayuda a sostener a su familia económicamente.

Por no contar con las herramientas necesarias, ha dejado pasar muchos trabajos, así que, decidió ingresar a Fundaciòn Realidad para hacer un préstamo y mejorar su establecimiento. 

Ya cuenta con sus clientes, generalmente los D. las escuelas primarias y jardín D. niños y niñas, para estos, les fabrica sus uniformes escolares. Una experiencia muy bonita que tuvo fue cuando realizó los trajes D. una graduación D. L. escueL. secundaria donD. recibió muchos halagos.

El sueño mas granD. que tiene es D. tener un establecimiento con maquinas actualizadas que le permita imprimir logotipos para así dar el servicio completo.

Las otras 4 mujeres que a continuación se mencionan también tienen su negocio, a excepción D. L. señora MariceL. García A., quien iniciará L. venta D. frutas y legumbres. Ma Isabel González Nañez, tiene un establecimiento donD. venD. telas para fabricar ropa. Maria Leida López D. L. C., venD. órdenes D. comida casa por casa en su misma comunidad. Maria Magdai Vázquez González, se dedica  a bordar bolsas y tapetes para venderlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Flamboyan," is located in the San Sebastián neighborhood in the city of Tecpatán in the state of Chiapas, México. There are 5 members in the group. Among them is señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, who is a native of Tecpatán Mezcalapa in Chiapas, who says, "I have a name that might not be very popular, but I like it. My parents decided to name me this after a very beloved aunt." She is 38 and only completed primary school. Her husband is named Rigoberto Bautista Narváez and works at a furniture store. They have 3 children who are all still in primary school in the same city. Orfanel Pérez Sánchez makes a living by making clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses. She has done this for 18 years and learned through some courses that she took in her area. Today she does this work with great priD. because it helps her sustain her family economically. Because she doesn't have the necessary tools, she has had to pass on a lot of work, so she decided to join Fundación Realidad to get a loan and improve her business. She already has customers, and generally she makes school uniforms for primary school and preschool students. She had a lovely experience when she maD. some suits for a high school graduation where she received a lot of praise. Her biggest dream is to have a business with updated machines that will let her make logos and offer complete service. The other 4 women who are mentioned next also have their own businesses, except for MariceL. García A., who will start selling fruits and vegetables. Maria Isabel Nañez has a business where she sells fabric to make clothing. Maria Leida López D. L. C. sells food from door to door in her community. Maria Magdai Vázquez González embroiders bags and tablecloths to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to be able to make clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses to later sell.  Also to make school uniforms and to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina  R., es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente.
Ella se dedica a la compra y  venta de maderas y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Yarina” desde hace cinco años. Karina empezó con un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de golosinas. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà madera para posteriormente venderla.
La meta de Karina  es tener un local propio para la venta de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Karina R. is an enterprising and collaborative member. She lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is the mother of a young child. She has the support of her husband who is an independent worker. She dedicates herself to buying and selling wood and has been a part of the community bank, "Perlas de Yarina" ["Pearls of Yarina"], for five years. Karina began with a loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy sweets [for another project]. Currently, she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy wood to sell. Karina's goal is to have her own store to sell food products.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento VIRGEN D. FATIMA esta conformado por la señora Gladys, quien tiene como actividad una zapateria donD. realiza y venD. calzados ubicado en su domicilio, doña Maria, es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. dulces y una cabina telefonica  y la señora Silvia, es la secretaria D. actas cuya actividad es promotora D. calzados batta por catalogo.  Estas tres señoras son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por once personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas y se conocen por mucho tiempo. Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 20% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio ambulando y no cuenta con domicilio propio son madres D. familia  muy trabajadoras donD. el negocio es el unico ingreso con el que cuentan para colaborar con los gastos del hogar, son  responsables en sus actividades y estan segura D. demostrar cumplimiento y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The executive team of the community bank, "Virgen D. Fatima", is comprised of three women: Gladys, Maria, and Silvia. Gladys' business is a shoe store located in her home where she makes and sells footwear. Maria is the treasurer and dedicates herself to selling sweets and has a telephone booth. Silvia is the secretary, and her job is to promote Bata footwear through a catalogue. These three women are the heads of the community bank, which is comprised of eleven members who are accountable to each other and have known each other for a long time. The majority have their own business, and the other 20 percent sell merchandise as peddlers and do not have their own homes. These women are hardworking mothers whose business is their only source of income with which to contribute to paying household expenses. They are responsible for their businesses, and they are sure that they will fulfill their obligations and demonstrate responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JULIO CESAR, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, El socio vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad, el es casado y tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad; el socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el trabaja junto a su esposa en la realización de artesanía, ellos tiene una tienda en la plaza principal del pueblo de Pisac y venden cerámicas, piedras cuarzos, huacos, desde hace 15 años, ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio como capital de trabajo. Ellos necesitan compras piedras en diferentes colores para que los otros artesanos que se dedican a la realización de joyas compren las piedras para elaborar pendientes, collares, anillos y otros trabajos en plata y alpaca.

Nuestro socio  valora y agradece el préstamo y  la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, JULIO CESAR, belongs to the “INTIWATANA” cooperative bank. He lives in Pisac, which is situated 40 minutes from the city of Cusco, in the Calca province. It is a small town that has inherited some beautiful Incan constructions, and is an obligatory visit for tourists who travel to see Cusco. Julio is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 13, 11 and 6. He dedicates himself to retail sales, working together with his wife to sell handicrafts. They have a store located in the main plaza of the town of Pisac, where they have been selling ceramics, quartz stones, and clay pottery for the past 15 years. They are requesting a loan to reinvest into their business as working capital. They need to buy various colors of stones to sell to other craftspeople that dedicate themselves to making jewelry, and need the stones to make pendants, necklaces, rings and other works in silver and alpaca. Our member values and appreciates access to credit via this means, and likewise commits to pay the loan back within the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, stones and quartz, to make jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 30 years old and single, but he supports his two brothers. Felix lives in the Nyarugenge District of Kigali Province. 

Felix runs a  cinema. Felix has chosen this business because there are many young people in his village who like to watch movies. This business is profitable. This is his first successful year in his business. He is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance to buy some new equipment and air conditioning, which is very important to attract more customers. 

Felix employs four people from his community so his business runs smoothly. This loan will help him to improve his business by buying modern equipment and supplies.  When Felix obtains more profits, he expects to save money and to reinvest in the business. 

His cinema is open from 6:00 in the morning to 9:00 (2100) in the evening every day except Sunday.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment, including air conditioning, for his cinema

loans.name: Domingos Cumbane

texts.pt:
Domingos Cumbane S. nasceu na Província de Tete, Norte de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 5, 3, anos e gémeos de 10 meses de idade, o mais velho vai a escolinha. Frequenta 11ą classe, não foi possível continuar antes porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com seus familiares não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de sua família.
Sai da Província de Tete para Borne afim de cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório no ano de 1984. Depois de terminar com a sua carreira militar decidiu continuar a trabalhar no Ministério da Defesa como motorista. Mais tarde casou se com a sua esposa e fixaram uma residência no bairro 07 no Distrito de Boane onde vive actualmente com a sua família. Faz este trabalho há mais de 24 anos e tem como salário o valor de 3.300.00mt por, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, barrotes, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar perfeitamente a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Domingos Cumbane S. was born in Tete province in northern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 4 children who are 5, 3, and 10 months (twins). The oldest goes to school. He attended 11th grade, but was not able to continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and doesn't support anyone else besides them. He left Tete province for Boane to fulfill his obligatory military service in 1984. After finishing his military career, he decided to continue to work in the Ministry of Defense as a driver. Later, he married his wife and they secured a house in Bairro 07 in Boane district, where he lives now with his family. He has been at this job for more than 24 years and earns a monthly salary of 3,300 MZN. He uses this to pay for household expenses and he even saves some in his bank account. He has had loans with the Millennium Bim bank, but he later decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (rebar, support beams, cement, sand, etc.) in order to finish with his work [building his house]. The previous loan was for 7,000 MZN, for the same purpose. In the future, he would like to request more loans to perfectly finish and furnish his house in order to offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K. and her husband, Mr. Phally Chlam, have been married for more than a year and just have a young daughter. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sokheng has been a silk weaver for more than five years. When she is free, whe also assists her husband in his business raising chickens. Sokheng has obtained one Kiva loan already. She now is now requesting another loan of US$500 to put an addition on her house and to build a fence around it.

loans.use: To put an addition on her house and to build a fence around it

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. sells fish for a living. She is 37 years old and married with three children. Her husband goes out to sea to fish, and she sells his catch at the market.

Emily is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishnets and other fishing tackle. She dreams of being successful in her business so she can give her children a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and other fishing tackle.

loans.name: Norma Irene

texts.es:
Norma T. de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia). Su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera, pero ya todos sus hijos están casados. 

Norma hace 10 años construyo su casa y también la parte delantera la reubico para un pequeño local, pero por falta de ingresos no la pudo terminar y dejo unido el local con la sala y ubico una pequeña tienda. 

Norma ahora tiene una pequeña tienda, trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días, en la tienda vende cereales, bebidas, dulces, golosinas, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, cereales para su tienda y poder así surtirla más. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor el local de su tienda, y tener su tienda mas surtida.
texts.en:
Norma T. is 52 years old. She lives in an urban area of Guasmo, which was named after the type of tree Guazuma ulmifolia. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is a single mother, but all her children are already married. Ten years ago, Norma built her house and set aside a space in the back for a small business. Due to lack of funds, she was not able to finish and left the space attached to the living room and put in a small store. Norma now has a small store, where she works from 7:00AM until 8:00PM every day. She sells cereals, drinks, candies, sweets, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, drinks, and cereals for her store to be able to stock it more fully. In the future, she wants to build a better space for her store and have it more well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, drinks, and cereals

loans.name: Mr. Sambath Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eleven people who live in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. Mr. Sambath B. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose that will improve their businesses in the future.

Mr. Sambath B. is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Chea Net Keo, is a fish and fruit seller in the local market. Since his wife’s business is going well, Mr. Sambath B. wants to expand it to improve his family’s living conditions. He is seeking a loan to buy more fruits and fish for his wife to resell. 

The couple supports seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while another three are studying in the local public school, and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and fish for his wife to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal, empty bottles and other used products in the local community. Annie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut C., age 37, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a local high school, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field. She will use any additional profit to support the education of her children.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee G. is from the village of  Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years-old and married. To make a living, Analee owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Analee is just starting this business.

In 2009, Analee joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Analee is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Analee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: C5601 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Josephine was born in 1984. She is married with one child and two dependant relatives. No one in Josephine's family has an occupation. That's why Josephine has to work hard so that she develops her business. Josephine owns a business selling various products in her living space. This business is profitable, but she does not have enough money to invest. That is why she needs a loan. Josephine is the leader of a group called TUZAMURANE in the local language.

Josephine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their investment so that they can satisfy their customers. Once this satisfaction is reached, Josephine and her group will get enough money, which will help them to sort out some family problems and business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 28 years old, married and has a child. He graduated from intermediate school. 

The borrower is a baker. He will use this loan to purchase a kneading machine, flour and another clay oven. 

The borrower has a wealth of experience and works continuously. He has a good reputation in the market and many clients buy bread from him because his bakery is clean and fresh. He has two workers working with him.

loans.use: To buy a kneading machine, flour, and a clay oven

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like banana cue in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai T. N. is 39 years old and has 2 children who attend high school and secondary school. She runs a shop that serves soft drink and draught beer. She also provides a motor cleaning service. She has been a very good SeDa client for 7 years. Currently, she wants a loan of 9,374,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is from the village of Purok 2, Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Minda is about four years into this business and earns approximately $125 a month for this activity.

In 2008, Minda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC amounting 7,000 PHP. 

Minda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for her sari-sari store. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.ru:
Husniyya K. (na fotoqrafii yeyo sin) 48 let. Ona mat 2 detey , sin kotoriy rabotayet taxistom  i doch kotoroy 17 let ona uchitsya v shkole. Husniyya yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya  mashini. Uje 7 let kak yeyo sin zanimayetsya etim biznessom vojdeniya taxi.
texts.en:
Husniyya K. (her son is in the photo) is 48 years old.  She is the mother of two children.  Her son works as a taxi driver, and her daughter, who is seventeen, goes to school.  Husniyya is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region.

She needs 2000 AZN for car repair.  Her son has been driving a taxi for seven years.

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Chariyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Chariyas T., and her husband, Mr. Ousman Sos (pictured together), were married in 1985 and have six children. They live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chariyas sells fish in the village market. Her husband is a fisherman. She hopes to generate more income by supplementing her business by selling potatoes, but she does not have the capital to do so. Therefore, Chariyas is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: For capital to buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Kanyinya Bee Keepers, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Hard working and determined Z. Pafura of Kanyinya Bee keepers, Kyenjojo, aged 46, has been operating a livestock business that deals in goat rearing in Kanyinya, Kyenjojo. The married father of 8 children engages in the purchase of goats which he grazes, fattens and sells at a later stage for a better price as well as selling cows that are bought by butchers in the area.

This activity has seen him fetch 168,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis, which has helped him in taking up family responsibilities like paying the children’s fees. He is very much into stocking more livestock on the farm, thus he needs this loan to help him achieve his goal as it will help him earn more sales revenue in the near future, thus improving the family income.

loans.use: purchase of goats for the farm for fattening and resale

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La señora Martha Rosa R., tiene la edad de 50 años habita con  su esposo en las pilas orientales, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos sobreviven de manera independiente, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 13 años. Años en los que se han enfrentado a problemas con la infección de los roedores, que disminuyen la producción de las siembras, es para la erradicación de este problema, que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insecticidas y fertilizantes que aporten un mantenimiento fito sanitario que combata el problema y les permita aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su capital de trabajo para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de ingreso a favor del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Martha Rosa R., 50, lives with her husband in Las Pilas Orientales.  They have 3 grown children, all independent.  Sra. Martha and her husband have operated a farm for 13 years, years in which they have faced problems with rodents that destroy much of what they grow.  Sra. Martha is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers to implement a treatment plan that will combat the problem.  The project will allow her to increase her yields and, in turn, her working capital, money for investing in new sources of income that will benefit her family.

loans.use: Mantenimiento Fitosanitario

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha M. es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por la parroquia de Chiquintad en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, sus iglesias hacen de esta una ciudad religiosa, su gente es muy calida y amable.

Doña Martha se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de manualidades como son muñecas, adornos de cocina, adornos de cerámica etc., actividad que realiza hace 8 meses y vende sus productos recorriendo la ciudad, trabaja muy poco debido a que sufre de insuficiencia renal lo que le limita en sus actividades diarias.

La Señora. Martha tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas  estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es maestro gasfitero, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su trabajo y en su hogar,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería. Su meta es de volver a  tener su lubricadora la misma que ha perdido por gastos de su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Martha M. is a member of the Génesis community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca in the parish of Chiquintad.  The city is well known for the beauty of its streets and its many churches.  The people are very warm and friendly.

For the last 8 months, Doña Martha has been selling different kinds of handicrafts, such as dolls, kitchen decorations, ceramic objects, etc.  She sells her products around the city, but she works very little because she has kidney failure, which limits her daily activities.

Martha is 42 years old and has three children, who are 14, 12, and 9 years old.  The two eldest are daughters, who are in school, while the third, a son, studies in the city.  Her husband is a master gasfitter.  They live in a house they built together.

She has been a member of the community bank for 12 years, and all of her previous loans have helped her in her work and housekeeping.  She will use the latest loan to buy more merchandise.  Her goal is to get back the oil changing business she lost because of expenses related to her illness.

loans.use: To buy dolls, kitchen decorations, ceramic objects, etc.

loans.name: Fausta Flora

texts.es:
Fausta es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil viuda, tiene 02 hijos, realizó estudios de educación primaria.

La señora era una socia ahorrista y se reincorpora nuevamente con el Movimiento  Manuela  R., con su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros y a la vez tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que comprará 100 unidades de cuy y gallinas, su hijo lo ayuda en su negocio.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la cuenta interna.
texts.en: Fausta is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" Community Bank in the Puno distruct, in the Puno province in the department of Puno. She is 42 and a widow. She has 2 children and an elementary school education. She saves money and has newly rejoined the Movimiento  Manuela  R.. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she invested in her domestic animal business. She also has a grocery business. Her new loan is for 1000.00 soles, money with which she will buy 100 units of guinea pigs and hens. Her child helps her with the business. Her vision is to improve her business. What she likes about her Community Bank is the ease of getting a loan, and the internal support.

loans.use: to purchase domestic animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Zibiya

texts.en: Zibiya is 36 years old, married and has six children. Currently, three of her children attend school. Zibiya sells vegetables, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a carpenter. Zibiya will use the loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Zibiya plans to build a house. She dreams of becoming a supplier of vegetables in the future.

loans.use: To add more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es:
la joven Hilda Margarita H. es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la venta de
abarroteria en general, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
sus producto los vende a personas que viven en su comunidad y a varias personas que trabajan en las empresas meloneras y la azucareras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, su meta es poder hacer crecer su negocio cada dia mas y mas hasta tener una mercadito en donde tenga muchos productos y variedad que ofrecerles a sus clientes
texts.en:
Hilda Margarita H. is a hard working, responsible young woman.  She is a grocer and has a small grocery store installed in her house.

She sells her products to people living in her community and to several persons who work in the melon and sugar processing plants.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her goal is to make her store grow daily so that later on she can have a small market with lots of products and variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, lard, oil, margarine, soft drinks, snacks, cereal, oatmeal, soap, toilet paper, soups, pastas, noodles, candles, matches, batteries, salt and condiments.

loans.name: Rubi Gissela

texts.es: Cliente Tiene 21 años se dedica ala  Venta de Ropa en el mercado de Parcona desde hace dos años tiene un hijo de 3 años como carga familiar es madre soltera el papa de su hijo le pasa mensualmente para su alimentacion vive en la casa de sus padres quienes la apoyan con su niño solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio e incrementar su capital para asi salir adelante ya que ella se dedica a la venta de Ropa importada.Firma con su hermana que es su aval solidaria y la apoya para superarse y salir adelante sola.
texts.en: Rubi is 21 years old and has dedicated herself to selling clothing in the Parcona market for the past two years.  She has a 3-year-old son and is a single mother.  The father of her son offers her monthly child support.  She lives with her parents, who help her take care of her son.  Rubi is requesting this loan to invest in her business and to increase her capital so that she can get ahead and expand her imported clothing business.  She is signing with her sister who is her guarantor and who is helping her get ahead on her own.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar, who is married to Adham, is a mother of two daughters (Sawsan and Tamam) and one son (Haitham). Kawthar’s husband is a taxi driver in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Kawthar’s husband has been a taxi driver for five years. His car is the only source of income and it needs maintenance. Therefore, Kawthar took a loan from FATEN so that her husband can cover the expenses.

Kawthar’s husband appears in the picture here, as Kawthar is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To cover car maintenance expenses

loans.name: Laylyn

texts.en:
Laylyn B. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Laylyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Laylyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such canned goods, snack foods & milk in cans & boxes in the local community. Laylyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Laylyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Laylyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods.

loans.name: Alvaro Carrillo Group

texts.es:
Álvaro Carrillo, es el nombre de este grupo. La representante de este grupo es la señora Catalina C. López de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años que estudia la primaria. Catalina tiene  una estética en el cual da el servicio de corte de cabello, peinados, manicure, pedicure, tintes, rayitos de colores entre otros, así como también vende ropa, artículos deportivos, artículos para el hogar. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar más productos como son: ropa, colorantes, tintes, y algunos otros productos que necesita para su estética.
Ambrocia Eutiquia R. González es una de las integrantes de este grupo, tiene 67 años, es viuda desde hace 16 años, tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están vivos y 3 están muertos, además tiene a su manutención a 3 nietos los cuales estudian la secundaria, Ambrocia se dedica a la venta de refresco y agua, gracias a ello ah tenido para comer a pesar de los problemas que ah enfrentado siempre sabe como seguir adelante, otra solvencia económica que tiene es la pensión que recibe desde el fallecimiento de su esposo. Las situaciones más difíciles que ha enfrentado es que a su avanzada edad, ah tenido muchos problemas de salud, pero a pesar de ello siempre lucha por seguir adelante y sacar adelante a sus nietos.
Ambrocia solicito el préstamo para poder comprar y surtir su negocio y así poder vender mas productos y obtener un poco mas de ganancia, para que pueda seguir adelante y seguir dándole estudio a sus nietos, ya que ella quiere que se preparen para que así el día de mañana puedan tener un mejor futuro y nuevas oportunidades. Agradece a las personas de Kiva por su gran generosidad y apoyo.
Las personas que integran este grupo son Antonina(56 años-venta de perfumes), Epifania (57 años-venta de ropa), Feliza (66 años-venta de quesos), Criselda (28 años-venta de agua purificada) Alicia (27 años-venta de ropa), Paula Zacarías R. (51 años-muebles), Catalina C. (35 años -Estética), Minerva (56 años-comida mexicana), Juana Marisol (38 años-compra de cosméticos y material ferretero para la venta), Ambrocia (67 años-venta de refrescos y agua),  Cecilia (37 años-venta de antojitos) y Vicenta (51 años-venta de refrescos).
texts.en:
This group is called 'Álvaro Carrillo'.  The group's representative is 35 year-old Catalina C. López.  Catalina is a single mother who has a 10 year-old son in elementary school.  She owns a beauty salon where she provides customers with haircuts, hairdos, manicures, pedicures, hair dyes, highlights, etc.  She also sells clothes, sporting goods and household goods.  Catalina requested this loan to buy more products such as clothes, colorings, dyes and other products that she needs for her beauty salon.

Ambrocia Eutiquia R. González is another member of this group.  She is 67 years old and was widowed 16 years ago.  She gave birth to 6 children.  3 of her children are alive and 3 are dead.  Ambrocia also has 3 grandchildren in her care who are in high school.  Her business is selling soft drinks and water.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to provide her family with food in spite of the problems that she has faced.  She has always known how to get ahead in life.  An additional income that Ambrocia has is the pension that she has received since the death of her husband.  The most difficult situation that Ambrocia has faced is that, at her advanced age, she has suffered a lot of health problems.  However, in spite of this she has always fought hard to get herself and her grandchildren ahead in life.  Ambrocia requested this loan so that she could continue getting ahead and provide her grandchildren with an education.  She would like her grandchildren to prepare themselves for a better future and new opportunities.  Ambrocia is grateful to Kiva lenders for their great generosity and support.

The members of this group are: 56 year-old Antonia who sells perfumes, 57 year-old Epifania who sells clothes, 66 year-old Feliza who sells cheese, 28 year-old Criselda who sells purified water, 27 year-old Alicia who sells clothes, 51 year-old Paula Zacarías R. who sells furniture, 35 year-old Catalina C. who runs a beauty salon, 56 year-old Minerva who sells Mexican food, 38 year-old Juana Marisol who buys cosmetics and hardware to sell, 67 year-old Ambrocia who sells soft drinks and water, 37 year-old Cecliia who sells snacks and 51 year-old Vicenta who sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies, clothes and gifts

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two kids in Bint Jbeil. Ali owns two businesses to provide for his family. He owns a generator which he uses to supply the people in his village with electricity when there is no government-supplied electricity which is a major problem in Lebanon. Ali also owns a barber shop. 

Ali has 16 years of experience in both business ventures. He is well-known in the region and loved by his friends and neighbors. Ali is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to buy a car (Renault Rapid) that is necessary for his business. He will use his car to transport cables and generator parts to maintain his generator. He may also use his car to transport products for his barber shop such as shampoo, hair gel, or chairs. 

Ali’s previous loans have helped to improve his family’s situation and he hopes to provide his kids with the best education ever.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Mao, a married woman who was born in 1975, was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sun, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income to help support their family.  Aside from fishing, they also have a plot of land that they use to grow various vegetables.  

This couple has seven children. Two are laborers, one is farmer, three are attending the local school, and the youngest one is 1 year old.

This couple doesn't have a boat for fishing, so Mrs. Mao would like to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Betty Robertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Betty, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos que ya son mayores de edad, tres  de sus hijos viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante. 

Ella y su esposo tienen un negocio familiar en el que venden repuestos de carros, aceites, liquido de frenos, entre otros productos, tienen un local en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo allí  trabajan todos los días de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sábados y domingos hasta las 13h00. Pero en su casa si algunos de sus clientes necesitan algo también tiene productos para vender. Estos repuestos y productos los compran en Guayaquil y Manta. Sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva con este negocio por más de 20 años y que gracias a Dios siempre se han mantenido en el negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos, aceites, líquidos de frenos, etc. Está casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones aprende mucho y porque los créditos les son de gran ayuda.

Su sueño  tener un local propio ya que donde tienen el negocio es arrendado.
texts.en:
The “22 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place renown for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Betty, 58, here.  She’s married and has four adult children.  Three of them still live with her.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She and her husband have a small family business selling spare parts for cars, lubricants and brake fluid, among other products.  They have a locale in downtown Portoviejo.  They work there every day, Monday through Friday, 8-6 and on Saturday and Sunday until 1pm.  However, she also keeps some products at home in case some of her customers need something she can sell them.  They buy these parts and products in Guayaquil and in Manta.  Her children help her with the business.  She tells us that her husband has had the business for over 20 years and, thanks be to God, they have always stayed in business.

This loan is to buy parts, lubricants, brake fluid, etc.  She’s been in the communal bank almost from the beginning and she likes it because she learns a lot in the meetings and because the loans are of great help.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own because they rent the one they have now.

loans.use: to buy car replacement parts: lubricants, brake fluid, etc.

loans.name: Rassoul

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. One other family member also lives with him.

Rassoul has had a shop selling all kind of fish since 1996. He gained good experience in this field from his parents. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 to build a basin and to expand his purchase of fish. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a basin and to expand his purchase of fish.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena  es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con  servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Los habitantes de ésta zona se dedican a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo.

Lorena se dedica desde hace unos años al servicio de preparación y venta de comida en los diferentes molinos que existen en la carretera a Lambayeque ofreciendo menú para los obreros que laboran ahí, también vende ropa de trabajo y sandalias a los mismos trabajadores.  Al ver que su negocio va creciendo a solicitado un préstamoa Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de insumos para seguir preparando la comida y mayor cantidad de ropa para los trabajadores que es lo que más demanda tiene, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Lorena con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno quiere puede lograr su objetivo, como que sus hijos tengan mejores estudios en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Lorena, 30, is a mother living with her husband and children in her own house which has water and electricity and is located in Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this area are farmers, raise livestock and work in tourism.

For some years now Lorena has been making and selling food at the various mills that exist along the highway to Lambayeque.  She offers daily menus to the workers who work there.  She also sells work clothes and sandals to those same workers.

Seeing that her business is gradually growing she asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy ingredients to continue preparing the food and to buy a larger amount of clothes for the workers since this is what’s in greatest demand.  Income she earns will be used to repay the loan and to have a better quality of life for her family.

With her work and determination to get ahead, Lorena has won over the trust and respect of her neighbors proving that when one wants to one can reach one’s goals like her children having a better education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the meals and to acquire more clothes for the mill workers.

loans.name: Motuli

texts.en:
Motuli is 39 years of age and married with six children. Motuli owns & operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Motuli needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Motuli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Motuli's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Thelma Del Socorro

texts.es: Thelma Del Socorro es una mujer emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad. Tiene más de 10 años en su negocio como es una pulpería. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido de salud ya que muchas veces no se siente bien y tiene que cerrar su negocio, es así que pierde clientes, pero con todas las ganas de salir adelante ha luchado cada día para que esto no suceda. Este es el motivo del crédito para la compra de leche, pan, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico y golosinas.
texts.en:
Thelma del Socorro is an enterprising woman who enjoys her work running a grocery store, a job she’s been doing for more than ten years. One of her problems has been health issues, as she often doesn’t feel well and has to close the store. This results in lost customers. 

However, Thelma is very eager to get ahead and makes an effort every day not to let this happen. This is her motive for wishing to take out a loan to buy milk, bread, detergent, soap, canned goods, toilet paper, and candy.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, detergent, soap, canned goods, toilet paper, and candy

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with six children, three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She operates a water-vending business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to furnish her house, purchase sand and cement and pay for labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To furnish her house, purchase sand and cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling fruit and candies in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fruits and candies to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 17 years. Marilyn earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fruits and candies to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a responsible and cheerful person. He enjoys daily activities in his farming business. David is single and devotes himself full time to maintaining his business which is the only source of income for his family. He lives in a village with his parents. He plants and harvests rice twice a year and merchandises his yield to traders in his village. David's parents are old and not capable of working anymore to make a living on their own. Last cropping season in May, he produced a good crop and earned about 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). The income generated from the business went for his family's daily consumption and investment in the maintenance of his business. The rest of the profit was saved for future emergencies.

David wants to achieve a bountiful harvest to increase his earnings which is why he is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor costs of sowing and transplanting rice seedlings on his farm. According to him, he pays laborers who help him with the farm activities and thanks them for the services they render. With the help of this loan, he will thoroughly prepare his farm land for the next planting season. In the future, David wants to strengthen his business to achieve financial independence. Someday, he also wants to have his own family – a wife and children to raise too.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay labor costs for sowing and transplanting rice seedlings on his farm.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es: Mariela está solicitando el crédito para pagar un curso de inglés conversacional. Junto a su esposo trabaja y el le apoyará en los costo del curso. El curso tendrá una duración de 3 años. Tiene la responsabilidad de hijos, es por eso que pone mucho emppeño en sacar este curso porque esto le ayudará a aspirar a un mejor puesto de trabajo y así salir adelante junto a su familia, y poder brindarle una vida digna a sus hijos
texts.en: Mariela is requesting a loan to pay for a course in conversational English.  She works with her husband, and he is helping her with the costs of the course.  The course will take three months.  She is responsible for her children, and this is why she is very determined to move ahead with this course, as it will help her to attain a better job.  In this way she will move forward in life with her family and provide her children with a worthy life.

loans.use: to pay for an English course.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador y vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Fulgenia de 53 años de edad y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda todo su apoyo. Paulino, a la edad que tiene cree que todavía le falta mucho para concretar sus planes y por ello cuenta con muchos proyectos en mente para sobre salir de la pobreza que aqueja su hogar. Uno de sus metas a largo plazo es tener un criadero de peces, actualmente solo se dedica a cultivar diversidad de plantas nativas en su parcela como: cacao, café, achiote y palillo, productos que le brindan una buena sostenibilidad económica para mejorar su condición de vida donde viene trabajando durante 25 años. Sinn embargo, Paulino necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para mejorar las fachadas de su vivienda y por ello acude a los préstamos, pues necesita mejorar el techo de su vivienda con calaminas nuevas, listones y vigas que le duren por un buen tiempo para así otorgarles una buena cobija a sus seres queridos. Este será su octavo crédito y por ende necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando y por lo cual se compromete a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, refaccionará  su morada y  comprará  calaminas, listones y clavos para mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Paulino is 53 years old, hard-working, and owns his own home where he lives alongside his wife Fulgenia who is 53 years old and their 2 kids whom Paulino offers his full support to.  Paulino feels that at his age he still has a ways to go before he completes his plans and he has many projects in mind to get out of the poverty that plagues his household.  One of his long-term goals is to have a fishery but currently he dedicates himself to cultivating various native plants such as: cocoa, coffee, annato and palillo ( peruvian plant similar to guava-tree), products that help him sustain economically and where he has worked for over 25 years to improve his quality of life.  However, Paulino needs the financial support in order to make home improvements and this is why he resorted to loans.  He needs to upgrade his roof with new roofing sheets, rods and beams that will last for some time so this way he can provide a roof over his loved ones.  This will be his 8th loan and he needs all of your support to continue progressing, this is why he commits to punctually make all his payments.  With the 3,000 Nuevo Soles requested he would fix his home and purchase roofing sheets, rods and beams in order to fix the roof of the home.

loans.use: To purchase roofing sheets, wood slats, and nails.

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en:
KWT (groups of women farmers) Sawe Permata Indah is a group of women in the village Sawe, West Bali who have a wide range of businesses including shops, commercial food vendors, farmers and services. They are joined in groups to get a loan for business and training from MUK.

Agung Ayu uses her loans to increase business capital to buy more crops to sell such as banana, cocoa, coconut, jackfruit, etc. She will buy from farmers around the village and once collected, sell at the market. To transport the merchandise to the market, she uses a motorcycle. With its advantages, she dreams of buying a car to support her efforts.

loans.use: To buy banana, cocoa, coconut and other crops

loans.name: Biorifa

texts.ru: Биорифа проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. У нее двое детей. Она занимается животноводством. В основном она занимается разведением бычков. Этим видом деятельности занимается  два года. Кредит берет для закупа быка.
texts.en: Biorifa lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily breeds cattle.  Biorifa has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Asli

texts.en: Asli is 49 years old, married and has three sons. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). She works at purchasing and reselling cattle as well as milk with her husband. Asli is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and to educate her son, who today is a working adult, thanks to her example. She would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase an additional cow and calves to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Asli believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. She will then purchase additional cattle and increase their income further.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik runs a grocery shop. He has been engaged in this business for three years, and now has favorable conditions to enlarge it. 

Gagik plans to purchase more food and vegetables to cover the increasing demand. This loan will allow him to develop his business and get additional income, which means improved living conditions for his family. Gagik, his parents, and his brother live together.

loans.use: to pay for food and vegetables.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 38 years old and married with six children, ages 9-1, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He has no [other] dependents and he lives in his own house. He has a retail shop and has been operating it for eight years. He started as a market vendor and later started a shop. He faces the challenge of bad debtors and hopes to improve his business to a wholesale business. Simon needs money to buy soap, sugar and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and millet to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El se dedica a la compra y venta de llantas tiene un mercado amplio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende llantas de muy buena calidad y a muy buen precio además que el servicio es inigualable, las personas quedan satisfechas con la atención; El es un hombre dedicado al trabajo siempre dispuesto a buscar el éxito en su vida, el piensa que el secreto mas importante en la labor es la perseverancia, ya tiene record crediticio y esta calificado como buena paga quiere hacer crecer su negocio y no piensa rendirse, es por eso que le solicita de nuevo a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas por mayor. Marco Antonio tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marco Antonio is 43 years old and lives with his common-law wife and children.  He buys and sells tires for a living and has a broad market.  He has attracted many customers with his top quality products and low prices.  He also provides a unique service and customers are very satisfied with his attentiveness.  He is dedicated to his work and always seeking success in life.  In his mind, the most important secret is perseverance.  He is classified as a good borrower on his credit record.  He wants to grow his business and not give up.  Therefore he has requested a new loan through INTEGRAL to buy wholesale tires.  Marco Antonio believes that, in this way, he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wholesale tires.
