Aidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Señora Roxana se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujer como ser blusas, vestidos y pantalones,  su tienda es muy bonita bien organizada y muy accesible al publico.  La actividad que tiene le sirve para el sustento de su familia y de sus tres hijos ya que ella es la responsable de la educación de ellos y su padre es responsable de la alimentación y vestir ella hace constantes viajes para abastecerse de mercadería ya que su actividad así lo demanda es muy trabajadora por que las veces que pude pasar por el puesto ella siempre está atendiendo personalmente, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que su venta se incrementa, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roxana sells women’s clothes like blouses, dresses and pants.  Her store is very pretty, well organized and accessible to the public.  Her work makes it possible for her to support her family and her three children since she’s responsible for their education; their father covers food and clothing. 

She makes constant trips to stock up on merchandise because her work so requires.  She is very hard working.  One can pass by her stand any number of times and one will always find her tending to customers personally.

She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise for the end of year festivities because sales increase.  She is grateful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fix up the entire stand.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells sweet doughnuts at Abura. She is single but takes care of three children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to prepare the doughnuts to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make doughnuts

loans.name: Moyiare

texts.en:
Moyiare S. is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of four school-going children. Moyiare is a farmer who has been farming for the last year.

Moyiare learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 40,000 KES to buy seeds and hire help for planting her land. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can plant wheat on a larger scale. She believes she is hard working and by having the right resources at her disposal she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire help for planting her piece of land.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. está muy agradecida por su gran cooperación en el anterior préstamo en cual les pudo pagar a sus hijos las colegiaturas y exámenes y así sus niños pudieron terminar ese ciclo escolar. 
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un nuevo crédito ya que tiene que pagar la colegiatura y comprar los libros de su hijo, que esta estudiando la universidad y ella desea que tenga una carrera profesional para su futura. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos como empleada de una fabrica, ya que los gastos familiares se cubren con la pensión alimenticia que les reciben sus hijos de su papa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalba G. is very grateful for your enormous help with her previous loan, by which she was able to pay for school fees and tests, and so her children were able to finish that school year.

Currently she is asking for your help with a new loan as she already has to pay school fees and buy books for her son, who is studying at university and she wants him to have a professional career in the future.  She plans to repay the loan with the family's income from a factory job, as the family expenses are covered by a nutrition pension that her children get from their father.

loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn P. is from the village of Sta Lucia, Quirino, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Ailyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ailyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ailyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reynolds Lamin's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of teachers at the KMDEC School - Gandor in Kenema city. This school was established in September 2001 by the District Educational Committee in order to help meet the Millennium Development Goal, i.e. Education For All.
 
School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their meager salaries. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, housebuilding materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT on their behalf.

Reynolds Lamin V., 62 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. Reynolds was born in Sami Fulluma. He is married to a merchant and the couple has 7 children – 4 adults, 2 attending secondary school and 1 in college. Reynolds is going to use his share of this loan to buy house building materials such as iron, corrugated zincs, cements, and iron rods.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Ireen Joy

texts.en:
Ireen Joy B. is from the village of Mibando, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old and married with two school-aged children. Ireen Joy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and beverages in the local community. Ireen Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ireen Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Ireen Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and expand working capital. Ireen Joy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soft drinks, and toiletries

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man, living in Beirut with his wife and 4 children. Mohamad has owned an electronics sales shop since 2005, with 25 years of experience in this domain. He sells electronic games, DVDs and records special song CDs requested by his clients. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy new products to improve his business, such as updated Playstation, MP4 and DVDs. Mohamad works on staying up-to-date with every new release because all of his clients request new releases and he has to be ready for that at any time.

Mohamad's first loan was very impressive, he stated that it improved his social situation and helped in his children's education. Mohamad's prices are very special, and his customer service is unique. His clients can be anyone in the region, including tourists, since he is in a tourist area in Beirut, visited by almost all tourists visiting Lebanon. Mohamad hopes to expand his business through selling computer accessories and hardware.

loans.use: to add new products to his business, such as Playstation, MP4 and DVDs

loans.name: Creativas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza lives in Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities surrounding the main city of the Dominican Republic. Maritza and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Creativas 1 & 2 (Creatives).

Maritza requires a loan to buy fruit and vegetables. She also wants to buy a big box of second hand clothes. She runs a fruit and vegetables stall in front of her house, and she also sells second hand cloths by walking. She has had her business for over 6 years, after a friend gave her a loan to buy vegetables, and after some months she decided to sell fruit.  After hearing from Esperanza, she saw the opportunity to start selling second hand clothes. Her most difficult challenges have been to overcome economy crisis, and low income. She is mom of 4 children.

She says that her favorite thing is to work, and she wants to attend to the church. Maritza and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, and second hand clothes.

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "MIKAELA" se encuentra en su octavo ciclo , el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Susana quien es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su actividad económica es la venta D. cosméticos D. forma ambulante, su crédito esta destinado para el aumento D. su actividad económica comprando mercadería al por mayor en cosméticos, es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre piensa en su familia, por eso trabaja desD. tempranas horas, la tesorera La señora Bárbara quien tiene 3 hijos pequeñas y tiene como actividad económica la venta D. comida y su crédito esta destinado para aumento D. su capital D. trabajo comprando insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus comidas, todas las socias son personas responsables trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a su familia, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
The enterprising bank "MIKAELA" is in its eighth loan cycle and is formed by responsible and hardworking individuals. This Enterprising Bank is represented by the following members: President Susana who is married with two small children and her job consists of selling cosmetics by foot. 
The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics wholesale. She is a very hardworking woman who is considerate of her family which is why she begins working very early in the morning. Mrs. Bárbara is treasurer, has 3 children, sells food, and her loan will be used to buy snacks and ingredients to make her meals. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people that in many situations help their families thrive. They are thankful for the help offered by the institutions.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.en:
Ana Lucila is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Ana Lucila is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ana Lucila owns & operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers like afritada, caldereta, halang-halang & fish soup in the local community. Ana Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ana Lucila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ana Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Ana Lucila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Ana Lucila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que desea ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento desea colocar una losa en su casa ya que tiene la construcción detenida por falta de capital; por tal motivo solicita el apoyo en la institución para comprar el material de construcción. Aunque María comenta que actualmente vive en la casa de su marido y es donde viven sus hijos, esto no la detiene a terminar de construir su propio hogar por que este será el  fututo y patrimonio que les ofrecerá a sus tres pequeños cuando crezcan.
texts.en: María Guadalupe is a very responsible and hard-working person who would like to offer her three children a better quality of life.  Right now, she would like to lay a concrete floor in her home since building work has been paused owing to a lack of capital.  She is requesting support from our institution so that she can buy building supplies.  Although María tells us that she currently lives in her husband's home together with her children, this doesn't stop her from wanting to finish building her own home which will be the future property that she will offer her three young children when they grow up.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su cuarto ciclo con 17 integrantes.
Todas las mujeres, de escasos recursos, son personas unidas, luchadoras que cada dia tratan de llevar a sus casas el pan de cada dia, sustento de sus hijos y familares que de ellas dependen.
La Sra. Andresa de 35 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos todos ellos en edad escolar, los que la ayudan a vender frutas en la avenida Gral. Santos y Mcal. Lopez, ella regresa a su casa ya muy entrada la noche.
Es una señora muy sacrificada y valiente pues lucha dia y noche incansablemente para poder salir adelante con sus hijos y esposo, vive en el asentamiento de la zona de la ciudad de Asunción.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas tales como: naranja, banana, piña, melon, manzana, pera, etc.
texts.en:
This committee is in its fourth cycle with 17 members.  All the women are of scarce resources.  They are unified and tenacious trying to provide their homes, children and families that depend on them with daily sustenance.

Andrea, 35, has six school aged children.  They help her sell fruit on General Santos and Mariscal López Avenue.  She returns home quite late at night.

She is a very self sacrificing, brave woman because she fights untiringly day and night to be able to get ahead with her children and husband.  She lives in a population settlement in the city of Asunción.

She asked for the loan to buy fruit like oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, apples, pears, etc.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, pineapple, apples, pears, melons, etc.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.en:
Maria Delfina is 40 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in northern Ecuador. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two children aged 16 and 12. She is a humble woman who is dedicated to her home and her children. She is a hard worker and, above all, she works to help her children study. She calls her children her “reason to live.” 

Maria Delfina sells fruit in her shop. This loan, her third from FODEMI, is for the acquisition of more merchandise to sell. She wants to increase her working capital and purchase more fruit. She began her business twelve years ago when she moved from her natal village to Tulcán. Since there was no source of jobs available at the time, she took the initiative to begin to sell fruits on a cart and joined an association of street vendors. 

Maria Delfina reports that her business is going well. She has fixed clients that buy from her daily or weekly, supplies good quality fruit, and gives her clients great customer service. Her past loans have improved the quality of life for herself and her children because when she has more merchandise to sell, she obtains more profit. 

Maria Delfina has many goals for the future. Firstly, she wants a larger place where she can expand her business selling fruits and vegetables so that she does not have to sell fruit in the street. She wants to buy a small bit of land to build her own house in Tulcán. Finally, she dreams that her children will enter a university and study to be professionals. She was not able to attend university and she wants her children to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre San José  fue conformada en desD. el 2010, fue conformada gracias a la iniciativa D. la Sra. Elsa quien animada por un grupo D. mujeres decidieron conformar el comité, el cual actualmente trabaja en forma excelente con  responsabilidad, honestidad y han demostrado en todos los emprendimientos que les toco llevar  que se sienten muy bien trabajando en el grupo. El comité está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Elsa es decoradora, ella se define como una mujer creativa y llena D. imaginación. Le encanta lo que hace, ya que por medio D. u trabajo pueD. demostrar toda la creatividad que tiene. 
Elsa tiene un grupo D. clientes que siempre acuden a ella en caso D. fiestas y demás, para que sea ella quien decore. Sueña con algún dia poder tener un local con todo lo necesatio para la decoración D. grandes fiestas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas para la decoración, como asi también D. globos y demás, ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The San José Women's Committee was formed in 2010 thanks to the initiative of Elsa who, encouraged by a group of women, decided to form a committee.  The members of the committee are currently working very well together with responsibility and honesty.  They have shown, in all the undertakings they have maD., that they feel very happy working as a group.  The committee is maD. up of 11 hard-working and tenacious women.

Elsa is a decorator.  She describes herself as a creative woman who is full of imagination.  She loves what she does as, through her work, she is able to demonstrate all the creativity that she has.

Elsa has a group of customers who always come to her when they are planning parties and other events so that she can decorate for them.  She dreams of some day having premises with everything she needs for decorating large parties.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy decorative materials, balloons, etc.  This will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials, balloons, etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 57 years old and married with 7 children. Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like noodles, groceries, etc.. She has been running the sari-sari store for 27 years and also earns an income from coconut farming and selling slippers. Emelia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Josephine raises and sells mature and grown pigs . She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs .

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Hector integrante y presidente del Banco comunal “La Santiago”, perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de artículos de bazar y paquetería en un puesto que ubica en un persa (feria libre). Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 20 años. Su horario de trabajo es durante los días jueves, sábados, domingos y festivos. 
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en importadoras en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará lentes de sol, anteojos para leer, ropa delgada, encendedores para regalo, entre otros.
Las metas para su negocio son abastecer su negocio con mercadería, para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, de ésta manera trabajar más y así obtener mayores ingresos. 
Hector vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad, los planes para ella son estudiar licenciatura en literatura, por lo tanto uno de los sueños de Hector es concretar éste proyecto para que su hija logre ser una profesional. Además al obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio, pretende terminar de pagar el crédito automotriz que solicitó hace poco tiempo atrás.  Otro de sus sueños es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y más confortable.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben específicamente por que quiere concretar todos sus proyectos y además que disfruta mucho lo que realiza.  
Hector está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicio brindado por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que con las reuniones ha aprendido a conocer personas muy especiales y las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han permitido administrar el dinero de su negocio.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Héctor is a member of the Communal Bank "La Santiago", and is the Bank's president.  The bank is located in the community of Estación Central, in the city of Santiago.

He works in business, specifically selling stationery and packaging items at a stall located in a bazaar (open market).  He has been working in this business for the last 20 years.  His schedule is to work during Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  He usually buys his merchandise from importers in the center of the city of Santiago.

With the loan, he will buy sunglasses, reading glasses, thin clothing, gift cigarette lighters, and other things.  His goals for his business are to stock up his business with merchandise to as to offer variety to his customers.  In this way he will have more work, and and thus be able to earn better income.

Héctor lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter.  The plans are for her to study for a degree in literature, so one of Hector's dreams is to achieve this project so that his daughter can become a professional.  In addition to earning more from his business, he intends to finish paying off his auto loan, which he took out a short while back.  One of his dreams is to provide his family with a better quality of life, and a more comfortable life.

His motivation for continuing with his business is specifically due to the fact that he wants to achieve all his projects, and additionally he very much enjoys what he does.

Héctor is very happy and grateful for the loan and for the service provided by Fondo Esperanza.  He also comments that through the meetings he has got to know many special people, and the trainings that take place at the meetings have allowed him to manage his business' money.

Estación Central is a community located in the center of Santiago (capital of Chile).  It owes its names to the Central Railway Station, which dates back to 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983.  In its early days, this station, together with the Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital for the Valparaíso - Santiago route, and also for routes from the southern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses, reading glasses, thin clothing, gift cigarette lighters, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, charcoal, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 52-year-old married woman with 6 grown children. They live in the village of Carikrikan province of Isabela. Martina is a very patient and hardworking mother. 

Martina is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy spare parts for her motorcycle in order to maintain the service that she provides to her community. Martina hopes that someday, aside from her motorcycle business, she can establish her own store to have an additional income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Renie Fe

texts.en:
Renie Fe is married with five grown children. She is 58 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
For the past five years, Renie Fe has engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. It was her field of interest even when she was still young and single. She got used to their everyday routine - cleaning their home, feeding and bathing them. While not the only source of income, Renie Fe earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Renie Fe hopes to raise them all successfully and trade them at a very good price. She plans to repair and widen their shelter, hopefully within the year.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Leonel tiene 26 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos.

Él se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura a sembrar maíz, fríjol y maicillo. Su papá fue quien le enseño a trabajar en la tierra ya que son personas humildes, responsables con valores y principios. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas se debe trasladar desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad viajando en autobús por 18 kilómetros.

Don Leonel esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar  teja y lamina para mejorar su casa, ya que en época de lluvia se  moja su casa y tienen problemas, de esta manera el podrá brindarle a su familia seguridad y que ellos se sientan bien y puedan vivir mas tranquilos.

Don Leonel tiene pensado que en unos años el construirá su casa de adobe, por que actualmente vive en una casa de bahareque y él desea dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leonel, 26, is married and has two children.  He’s spent his entire life farming corn, beans and sorghum.  His father taught him how to work the soil since they are humble, responsible people with good values and principles.  In order to buy his farming supplies he must travel from his community to the city on an 18 kilometer bus trip.

Leonel is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy roofing tile and metal sheeting to improve his house because during the rainy season his house gets wet and they have problems.  This way he will be able to provide his family with more safety so that they will feel good and be able to live more peacefully.

Leonel intends in a few years to build his house out of adobe because it’s currently made of “bahareque” (sticks interlaced with mud) and he wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy roofing tile and metal sheeting for his house.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 54, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Doroteo, a driver, and is mother to four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their every-day expenses.

Marlyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 5,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be use it to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Marlyn dreams to expand her business and provide a good future for her children. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: Cristina, Maria De La Cruz, Georgina, Marina, Janette Del Socorro, Pabla Teresa, Danelia Francisca, Alma Rosa, Maria Eulogia y Lilliam conforman el banco comunal Las Mariposas. Cristina se dedica a  una pulpería, refrescos y ornados desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio, todas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras por lo que se sienten muy orgullosas de tener negocios en los cuales ellas puedan ser sus propias jefas. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Cristina, Maria De La Cruz, Georgina, Marina, Janette Del Socorro, Pabla Teresa, Danelia Francisca, Alma Rosa, Maria Eulogia y Lilliam  make up the communal bank called Las Mariposas. Cristina has had a grocery store, selling soft drinks and ornaments for more than 12 years. They are all enterprising and hardworking women who are proud of having businesses where they can be their own bosses. The reason for the loan is to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, dry grains, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, dry grains, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Tokotsun

texts.ru:
Токтосун 59 лет, замужем.  Вместе с мужем воспитали двоих детей. Токтосун долгое время работала швеей на производстве, эта профессия и сейчас помогает ей получать небольшую прибыль от пошива национальных изделий для свадеб.  
 Основная деятельность семьи Токтосун – это откорм и перепродажа скота и полеводство.  Начатое еще в 1992 году с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Токтосун обрабатывает 1,20 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают картофель и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Токтосун обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Токтосун планирует вложить в посев фасоли, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Tokotsun is 59 years old and married. She is raising two children with her husband. Tokotsun has been working as a seamstress for a long time and this trade is still helping her earn some income from periodically sewing traditional Kyrgyz wedding dresses. But now the main occupation of Tokotsun is raising livestock and produce sales. This business was started in 1992 with a starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS) and now it yields profits of 5,000 som (KGS) monthly, mainly from dairy sales. Tokotsun's family is currently farming a 3 acre plot of irrigated land where they grow potatoes and perennial grasses. In order to expand her herd and purchase more animals, Tokotsun has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). She is planing to use the profits from a larger herd to plant beans on their farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 31 year old married woman with four children between the ages of 12 and one. She has had a business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for two years.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and tea leaf. She will use the extra income she gets from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and tea leaf for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años y es casada desde hace 25 años. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país trabajando. Maria tiene 3 hijas de 11, 16 y 21 años de edad, las cuales están estudiando.  La familia vive en Barrio Morazan en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. 

Maria elabora y vende tortillas de maíz desde hace 21 años y dedica 8 horas diarias al negocio. Inició el negocio con ahorros propios. Ha solicitado 3 prestamos con ODEF y el actual de L10,000 es para compra de fardos de harina de maíz para elaborar tortillas. 

Su meta es mantener una mejor calidad de vida de su familia y darle estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
María, 54, has been married for 25 years.  Her husband is working abroad.  María has three daughters who are 11, 16 and 21 years old and attending school.  The family lives in San Pedro Sula’s Morazán neighborhood.

María has been making corn tortillas to sell for 21 years; she spends 8 hours a day in this business.  She started it with her own savings.  She has requested three ODEF loans and the current one is for L10,000 that she will use to buy packages of corn flour to make tortillas.  Her goal is to keep a better standard of living for her family and provide schooling for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas.

loans.name: Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
Odalis is the coordinator of her group Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras (Blessing of working women) 1, 2, and 3. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. Odalis makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Odalis is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has a miscellaneous sales business, where she sells shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other merchandise. With this loan she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory, buying specially clothes because of Christmas sales.

Odalis's long-term goal is to have a successful business, and to provide for her family needs, starting with buying their own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, sans enfant.Il est employé comme agent de sécurité dans une auberge de sa localité.En plus de cet emploi, il exerce un commerce de miel, d'huile de palm et de savon en poudre.Il a déjà bénéficié de trois prets de l'UIMCEC qu'il a payé sans retards. Son commerce lui permet d'avoir des revenus supplémentaires pour mieux entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son commerce, il sollicite un nouveau prêt de 250 000 f pour acheter du miel et de l'huile de palm. Son ambition est d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man with no children. He works as a security guard in a hostel in his area. In addition to this job, he sells honey, palm oil, and soap powder. He has already received 3 loans from UIMCEC, which he has paid back on time. With this business, he has an additional income, which allows him to better take care of his family. In order to strengthen his business, he is applying one more time for 250 000f, so he can buy honey and palm oil. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy honey and palm oil.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of 6 adult children and lives in Murang'a area of Central Kenya where he has been into active farming for 10 solid years after his retirement from formal employment. He gets additional income from a pension scheme.

John has requested a loan of 84,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a pedigreed dairy cow. He says he wants to raise only the best breeds to ensure he gets high returns. He previously acquired a loan of 50,000 KES which he repaid promptly. He hopes to improve his living standards with the loan and adds that the skills he has acquired in 10 years of active farming will be a great help.

John feels that the high cost of feeds is the major undoing in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 46 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos mayores  que juntos con su mama  le ayudan  a mirar  el negocio, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace seis años consecutivos. El crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos de pulpería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, papel higiénico etc.
texts.en: Jacqueline, 46, is married and has three adult children who together with her mother help her with the business.  She owns a home-based grocery store that she’s had for six consecutive years.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, toilet paper, etc. for the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: Con 27 años de edad diego Diego es un hombre soltero que vive con sus padres una hermana y un sobrino de 8 años, los fines de semana él se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno y los otros días trabaja de albañil; el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de reses para venderles en la feria de ganado de la ciudad de Julio Andrade, comenta que la experiencia que va adquiriendo en la compra de ganado hace que su negocio marche muy bien. El joven es muy trabajador y  aspira mejorar sus ingresos para comprar un terreno donde pueda criar a su ganado y también para ayudar a sus padres que se dedicar a vender frutas y apoyar en la educación de su sobrino.
texts.en: At age 27, Diego is a single man who lives with his parents, sister, and his eight year old nephew.  On the weekends he sells cattle and works as a mason the rest of the week.  He will invest the money from this loan to buy steers to sell at the livestock fair in the city of Julio Andrade.  He says that the buying and selling experience he has gained has made his business very good.  This young man is hard working and aspires to better his income to buy some land where he can raise his livestock and help his parents sell fruit and support his nephew’s education.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
I distribute vegetables in communities throughout the city where I live. I’ve been in this business for several years, and it’s given me enough income to support my family. My mayor clients are owners of food stores and mini-grocery stores, and also people who walk up to my stand to buy tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. Right now, demand is high so I need to stock up with good products to satisfy my client’s needs.

Loan Use: Purchase chili peppers, onions, and tomatoes

Me dedico a la distribucion de verduras en comunidades de mi ciudad. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio que me ha generado buenos ingresos para mantener a mi familia. Mis mayores compradores son personas dueñas de pulperias y mercaditos, asi como particulares que se acercan a mi carro a comprar tomates, cebollas o la verdura que les ofrezca. Ahorita tengo bastante demanda por lo que necesito abastecerme de buenos productos para satisfacer la necesidad de mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de chiles, cebollas y tomates.

loans.name: Filiata

texts.en: Filiata is 48 years old, married and has five children. She joined the program in 2004, and her husband and two of their sons have since then been doing taro farming. She sells the produce, including not only taro but also bananas and other vegetables, in the central market in Apia three times a week. Expanding her farm will enbale Filiata to improve her house and send her little children to school.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, fungicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Yaqoot

texts.en: Yaqoot is 43 years old. She lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a quilt-maker and also a gardener. She wants to take another loan to spend it making quilts for sale and also to improve her garden. She wants better crops than in the past, with more vegetables in the garden and different kinds of apples to sell in the bazaar. Now she can further her life and she is very happy.

loans.use: Buying Materials

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng H. is 35 years old and lives in Pray Veng Province with her husband and their 5 children.  Mrs. Seng H. and her husband work together farming their small plot of land, and together they earn $5/day.  Three of their children repair bicycles, and the other two are students.  This loan will be used to purchase seeds for the family's small plantation, and also to purchase some wood to repair their house so it doesn't leak during heavy rains.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair house and to purchase seeds for their plantation

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr:
Mrs. Geneviève A., 43, was born in Vogan (Vo Préfecture, Togo). She is married and mother of two children, but is also responsible for one other person. She sells used scraps of cloth, bags, sheets, etc. in N’kafu slums. Her husband has been out of work for two years now because the company where he was employed closed its doors. Geneviève thus is the breadwinner for the whole family. She manages to eke out a living for them with her rag business, however she would like to expand her little micro-business and earn more money from it. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 700 which will allow her to buy and resell more used cloth and such.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Geneviève est née en 1964 à Vogan (Préfecture de Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge une autre personne. Elle est commerçante de friperies (sacs, draps, torchons) dans le quartier de N’kafu. Son mari est au chômage depuis plus de 2 ans car la société dans laquelle il travaillait a fermé ses portes. Madame A. Geneviève se voit dans l’obligation de supporter toutes les charges du ménage. Elle arrive à s’en sortir grâce aux revenus. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 qui va servir à l'achat et à la vente de ces produits de fripperies.

loans.use:
Purchase and resale of used cloth (bags, sheets, etc.)
 Achat en gros et revente des fripperies (draps, sacs, torchons

loans.name: Azelia

texts.pt:
Azelia is a single mother of 1 child. She lives with her son and also a niece. Her son does not go to school yet because he has not reached the minimum required age, but as soon as he does, he will be enrolled in a public school. The loan amount will be used to purchase additional clothes in South Africa for her retail store. This will be her first loan. If all goes well and she does not face any unexpected problems, she intends on taking out other loans in order to build a better house. She resides in Homine Sede, in the province of Inhambane.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Azelia e mae solteira e tem 1 filho. Ela vive com o seu filho e com uma sobrinha. O filho de Azelia ainda nao estuda porque ainda nao tem idade. mas logo que atingir a idade exigida ela o ira matricular numa escola Publica.Ela que usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de artigos de vestuario e calcado na Africa do Sul para a sua tenda.este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela quer tomar. Se tudo correr bem e ela nao tiver nenhum problema ela pretende continuar a tomar outros emprestimos, pois que pretende construir uma casa melhorada . Ela vive em Homine Sede do Distrito do mesmo nome na Provincia de Inhambane.

loans.use: Azelia wants to use the money to purchase extra clothing goods.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
I am Rita A. from Lahore, a city with great history. I am married, and I have four children. All of my children are very brilliant and attend a nearby local school. I serve as a maid in one of the houses in a nearby posh area of the city, whereas my husband makes thread reels.

He buys the thread from a nearby market and winds it on the reels and then covers them in a plastic cover. He sells these reels in the same market. Our expenses are growing along with our children, and we feel the need of extra income.

Therefore, my husband plans to expand his business for which he requires a loan of $300. He will buy thread and plastic reels in bulk, and my eldest son will help him in the business, too. The increase in profits will help us continue with the studies of our children and will also assist us to improve our financial status.

loans.use: Expand thread reels business

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
Maria Félix C. is married and has one school-age child. Her son has been the reason for her efforts to better herself, in order to offer him familial stability and an education for the future.

For the past 10 years, Ms. Maria Félix has run a clothes sales business. She started with one market stand and she presently has three of them, thanks to the loans she has obtained from Ceprodel, as she sees it. This business is very profitable and sales have increased considerably over the years. Her starting capital, out of her savings, was of C$ 10,000 (córdobas). Her husband works with her and the starting capital was product of the savings of both of them.

Maria Félix has been doing business with Ceprodel for three years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been granted in a timely manner, helping her cover the needs of the business and serve her clients every day. She has a record of 22 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Félix C. es una señora casada y con un hijo en edad escolar. Su hijo ha sido la razón para que ella se superara y por él es que ella se ha esforzado, brindándole así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro.

Desde hace 10 años, doña Maria Félix tiene este negocio de venta de ropa; comenzó con un tramo, es decir con un puesto de venta; actualmente cuenta con tres puestos de ventas, que según ella ha llegado a alcanzar a través de los créditos que ha obtenido en Ceprodel. Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, y sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente con el paso de los años. Su capital de inicio fue de C$ 10,000 (córdobas), los cuales eran ahorros. Cabe señalar que el esposo trabaja junto con ella y que el capital con el que comenzaron fue producto del ahorro de ambos.

Maria Félix trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 22 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Wambizzi A Group

texts.en: Josephine has a retail shop business. She intends to use the extra business profits to cater for the family and also open up an account and save some. Nakato sells charcol and wants to use the loan to expand business. Safinah sells new clothes and wants to use the loan to add in stock.

loans.use: To increase stock in the shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
A while ago, Virginia worked in a restaurant as a cook. Nevertheless, after she lost her job, she decided to talk to her husband and explain her desire to sell products since Virginia believed that she had a knack for selling. She began in March 2004 selling produce and shellfish sauces and, in this way, complemented the work of her husband who is a purchaser/seller of fish and shellfish. Virginia would offer produce and sauces for the preparation of the fish and shellfish. Since then, she has dedicated herself to this task. Little by litte, she has grown her business.

Nevertheless, currently, she does not have sufficient merchandise for this Easter season when the sale of fish increases in her area. As a result, she is requesting a loan of US $475 which she will repay in four months. With your help, Virginia will be able to get ahead and help her three children to study at university.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace tiempo Virginia trabajaba en un restaurant como cocinera, sin embargo después de que se quedó sin empleo, decidió hablar con su esposo para explicarle las ganas que tenía de vender artículos, puesto que Virginia considera que tiene habilidades para las ventas. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 2004, con la venta de verduras y las salsas para mariscos, ya que de esta manera se complementaría con la actividad de su esposo, que es la compra-venta de pescados y mariscos, y Virginia ofrecería las verduras y las salsas para prepararlas y desde entonces se dedica a esta actividad. Y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para esta temporada de pascua que es cuando se incrementa la venta de pescados en su localidad, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, con tu ayuda Virginia podrá salir adelante y ayudar a sus tres hijos a estudiar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase material.

loans.name: Hamis' Salasala Group

texts.en:
Hamis, age 24, is married and has a six-month-old baby. For the past four years, he has made a living selling fish. He works from 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from his sales.

In the past, Hamis took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more fish to sell. He now hopes for another loan to buy more fish and to also start a fruit and vegetable stand. Hamis will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in fish, chips, clothing and fruit and vegetable sales.

In the picture, Hamis is the second person standing from the left.

loans.use: To buy more fish and other items to sell

loans.name: Haydee's Group

texts.es:
Dionisia, Haydee and Maximina have belonged to the “Virtud” Communal Bank for four months, one year and eight months respectively.

Dionisia is 65 years old, separated and has five children. She sells vegetables in the Nery García market.

Haydee, on the other hand, is 27 years old and has four children. She sells ice cream that she buys from another business. She has a small pushcart that she uses to sell the ice cream in the streets.

Maximina is 36 years old and is the single mother of three children. She sells cheese at wholesale prices to different stores. Maximina buys the cheese in her town of Cochabamba in addition to making cheese with milk she buys from local producers. She also embroiders blankets.

Dionisia, Haydee and Maximina need a loan of $375. The money will be used to buy beets, onions, tomatoes, ice cream, milk and blankets.

The dreams of these three women are to have enough money for their businesses, to offer their children a good education and to buy cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Dionisia, Haydee y Maximina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Virtud hace 4 meses, 1 año, 8 meses, respectivamente.

Dionisia es separada, tiene 65 años y 5 hijos, Dionisia vende verduras de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Por otro lado Haydee es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 4 hijos, Haydee vende helados que compra por mayor de una empresa, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla.

Mientras que Maximina es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Maximina vende quesos al por mayor a diferentes tiendas, Maximina compra los quesos de su pueblo Ccochabamba y también elabora quesos con leche que adquiere de los productores. También Maximina borda mantas.

Dionisia, Haydee y Maximina necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 200 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de betarraga, cebolla, tomate, helados, leche y mantas.

Los sueños de Dionisia, Haydee y Maximina son tener capital suficiente para sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y comprar ganado vacuno.

loans.use: Purchase beets, onions, tomatoes, ice cream, milk and blankets.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng Saroeun, 56, has operated a business selling food and grocery products since in Pilea Village, Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Each day, she can typically make about $3 (USD) in revenue. She is married with four children. One of her children is single and works as a driver; the other three are married and live outside the family’s home.

Seng Saroeun hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to fulfill her blooming customer demand. With the various kinds of products, she has is providing more options for her customers. In the future, she will use her additional profit, along with another loan, to keep expanding her inventory so that she will be able make ends meet.

Her husband, who is employed by a local hospital, appears in the photograph, because Mrs. Seng Saroeun was not available.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs a prosperous clothing and footwear kiosk in the city market in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. She decided to start her own business about seven years ago and has done very well. She sells a variety of womens' blouses, dresses and shoes. Income from the business help her and her husband, Valeryi, provide for the needs of their family of four. Valentina is typical in that she is one of many women entrepreneurs who desire to earn extra income to provide a better living for their families.

Valentina has requested a loan of $3000 to help her purchase additional inventory to sell. She typically buys clothes and footwear from her suppliers for further retail sale. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and allows her the flexibility to easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. Valentina’s business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past.  This loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Valentina and her family.

(Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: to increase her operating capital

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
This picture is of Aminata K. and Isha K.. Other members of the group were not available for a snap shot. They named their group Success. They have repaid their previous loan successfully but they would like an additional loan Le 1,600,000.00 to further help them expand their businesses.

Aminata is the leader of this group. She is 26 years of age. She was born in Moyamba, Southern Sierra Leone. She currently lives in Makeni together with her husband and 1 child. Aminata sells soft drinks, cold water, rum, cigarettes, candles etc. in a small kiosk.

loans.use: Expand on their current businesses.

loans.name: Iksan

texts.id: Iksan (36 tahun) bekerja sebagai tukang ojek, yaitu usaha angkutan sepeda motor. Usaha ini sudah dijalani bertahun-tahun dengan penghasilan rata-rata Rp.50.000 –Rp.70.000 per hari. Penghasilan bersih yang didapatnya disisihkan untuk diirimkan ke Jawa untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Saat ini, Iksan bersama istrinya Sukini tinggal di Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar kost dengan membayar per bulan. Istrinya bekerja sebagai penyulam atau penjahit. Rencananya pinjaman dari KIVA melalui DINARI bias dipakai untuk membeli sepeda motor bekas, dan nantinya dia akan mempekerjakan satu orang orang pekerja yang membantunya mencari penumpang. Dia berharap, dengan bertambahnya kendaraan yang dia miliki, usaha ini bias member dia penghasilan lebih sehingga dia bisa menabung untuk masa depan anaknya. Saat ini anak satu-satunya tinggal di Jawa bersama kakek dan neneknya.
texts.en:
Iksan 36 years old works as a motorcycle transporter, where he fetches people around on his bike. He has been working on this line for many years, and he earns about Rp.50.000 to Rp.70.000 per day. He sends his salary back to Jawa to support his child's education. At this moment he lives with his wife Sukini is Denpasar in a rented room. His wife works as a seamstress. With the financial assistance from Kiva via Dinari, he hopes to buy another motorcycle and employ one worker to help him. He hope that with an extra motorcycle he will be able to increase his income and start saving for his child's future. His only child currently live with his sister and grandmother in Jawa.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli Motor Bekar

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try S. is 59 years old and widowed with four children. She sells used goods that she purchases directly from previous owners and resells for a profit. Working hard at her business every day, she earns around US $4 per day.

One of her kids is married; the other children all live with her and each helps to find work to support their expenditures. Her eldest son is a motorcycle taxi drive who works transporting hotel guests. He rents his motorcycle from his uncle, paying US$3.75 per day for use of the bike. But while this payment is regular, his income from taxi driving is not always consistent.

To help increase her family's income, Try is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for her son’s taxi business. This way, he won’t have to pay his uncle, and he can increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son's taxi business.

loans.name: Manuela Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Rosa tiene 53 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Hilas de Plata y vive en Mz A8 lote 51 de Manuel Arévalo, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria y no continuó estudiando porque sus padres no quisieron apoyarla.
Se casó a los 20 años con Víctor Espejo y tuvo 7 hijos, de los cuales 3 son estudiantes y depende económicamente de ella.
Empezó vendiendo ceviche y luego incrementó la venta con tallarín. A sus comensales les gusta la sazón que tiene Manuelita, así la llaman cariñosamente los que la conocen, por lo que incrementó más la venta con el caldo de carne, de gallina, de cabeza. Los sábado y domingo elabora menú y todos comentan que es la mejor cocinera de la zona. Tiene un toldo ambulante fuera del Mercado Acomar.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas lo tomó como capital para vender en la noche cerca de su domicilio, pero no le dio resultado y lo dejó y todo su capital lo invirtió en los almuerzos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, implementará su negocio y cambiará el toldo con uno de mejor material al que tiene actualmente.
Manuelita sueña con tener un restaurant más céntrico.
texts.en:
Manuela Rosa is 53 years old and is a member of the Hilas de Plata Communal Bank in the Mz A8 lot 51 of Manuel Arévalo, in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through the third year of primary school and did not continue because her parents did not want to support her. She married Víctor Espejo at the age of 20 and had 7 children, 3 of whom are students and depend on her financially. She began selling ceviche and later augmented her business with the sale of noodles. Manuelita’s regular customers like her seasonings, and those who know her refer to her affectionately. She has also increased her business with the sale of various soups and broths. Saturdays and Sundays, she creates her menu and everyone comments that she is the best cook in the area. She has a mobile awning outside of the Acomar Market. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 payments, she began selling at night near her home. However, this did not succeed and she left it to invest all of her capital in lunch sales. With the requested loan of 500 soles, to be repaid in four payments, she will outfit her business and change her awning to one made with better material. Manuelita dreams of having a more centrally located restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To outfit her business and replace an awning with one of better quality.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun T., 28, is married and lives with her three children and husband in Battambong in Cambodia. From her home she has a business selling a variety of stuff such as eggs, tea, vegetable oil, laundry soap and other basic stuff to the people in the village to earn a living and is able to make about US$3.50 of profit each day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. He earns approximately US$3 per day to help support the family’s expenses. Three of their children are students. She said on average she spends around US$50 on food each month and US$30 on children’s education. 

Thoeun T. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to add to her grocery’s inventory and the rest of the loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: Add groceries and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
“Being a normal housewife who is engaged in a small enterprise, I believe that the money that I will borrow will help me generate an income which will help my husband to raise the needed money for our daily living,” Cristeta said.

Cristeta M. lives at Barangay Malamag East Tumauini, Isabela. The village is a relatively small and progressive community. She is married to Servillano who is a general farmer. They have four children, namely: 8-year-old Arnel and 12-year-old Servillano Jr., both of whom are elementary school students; 17-year-old Grace, who is a high school student; and the eldest child, 18-year-old Marvie who is a high school graduate.

Cristeta wants to borrow Php4,000 to buy two piglets, animal feed and vaccines. She also wants to repair her own backyard pigpen, so that she can add more piglets.
  
Her ultimate dream in life is to be able to support the college education of her two youngest sons.

loans.use: piglets, feed, vaccines and pigpen repair

loans.name: Salemalama

texts.en:
Salemalama P., age 32, is married with 2 children. She has two months of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the people of her village and the public one day each week. 

She is a new member of SPBD who has received only one previous SPBD loan. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala. SPBD loans are Salemalama’s only access to capital, because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her taro farm

loans.name: Jounied

texts.en:
Jounied is a 21-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber since 2007. Jounied feels he is unique because he is honest and does good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

When he first started his business, he didn't have enough cash, but he decided to go ahead with the business because he wanted to increase his family's income. Jounied requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, Jounied plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase plumbing tools for his business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs and she has been in this business since 1988. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Helen is 42 years old and she has 6 children. She lives at Ilaje and is requesting a loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. Helen appreciates the financial assistance provided to her in these hard times. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 23 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a vender productos y artículos diversos para el hogar, como cobertores de cama, utensilios de cocina, etc., a pedido, realiza este negocio desde hace un año. Empezó a vender en pequeñas cantidades, y ahora por su insistencia y esfuerzo han aumentado sus ventas. Recorre casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos, de esa manera deja su mercadería para cobrar día por día y con ello obtener mejores ganancias que le sirven para los gastos familiares. Andrea disfruta mucho de su trabajo, pero lo dificultoso es que es muy cansado caminar largos tramos diariamente, además de los riesgos que hay en las calles, es por ello que está planificando, para el futuro, establecerse en un local comercial. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que va a realizar en el banco comunal que integra. Con la cantidad solicitada comprará de más ollas y frazadas al por mayor para aprovechar esta nueva campaña de ventas.
texts.en:
Andrea is 23 years old and she lives with her son in her parents' house. She sells different products and articles for the home, like bed covers, cooking utensils, etc. She does this based on orders and has been doing this for a year. She started to sell things in small amounts, and now, because of her insistance and effort, her sales have risen. She goes from house to house to offer her products and in this way leaves her merchandise in order to charge day by day and therefore obtain higher earnings that will cover her families' outgoings. Andrea really enjoys her work, but the difficult thing about it is that it is very tiring walking for long streches each day, as well as the dangers that exist in the streets. It is for these reasons that in the future she plans to establish herself in a commercial store. It is her first loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic about the work she is going to carry out with the communal bank that she is a part of. With the solicited amount she will buy more saucepans and blankets in bulk to take advantage of this new sales campaign.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey lives and works in Beregovo. He owns a small lingerie business called "Image" in one of the local markets. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise which is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Andrey stay afloat with his business for five years. In fact, he has not only managed to keep his business sustainable and profitable, but has also increased his working capital up to 12,000 Hryvnia. His net profit is 2,500 Hryvnia a month. 

Andrey decided to go into this line of business because competition is lacking. He feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Andrey is a focused entrepreneur looking for growth and further expansion of his venture. He believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of his business. He is requesting a loan of 1,700 Hryvnia to increase his working capital. 

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid very quickly.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en: Lanuola P., 51, is married with 6 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $99).  SPBD loans are Lanuola’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Ingredients for making ice cakes

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie runs a general store in her village. She sells different kinds of vegetables, cooking ingredients and other commodities. Through her business, she is able to earn PHP1,000 (about US$21) weekly. She is 47 years old and married to Johnny P. Sr. According to Rosemarie, she wants to run her store as an alternative income to her husband’s business. This helps her family to meet their basic needs, which are expensive now-a-days.

Though she earns PHP1,000 weekly, it is still not enough. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP7,000.00 so she can buy more vegetables to sell in their village. This will allow Rosemarie to generate more income and save funds for her youngest daughter to pursue her college studies.

Rosemarie hopes that her loan request will be approved. The loan will greatly help her to earn her more profit and to attain her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: LAMINE S. EST NE EN 1954 à thies;il est marié et est père de trois enfants ;actuellement il est chauffeur dans une école privée et fait parallèlement du commerce;il dispose d'une quincaillerie chez et y vend des matériaux de construction:avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
LAMINE S. was born in Thiès in 1954. He's married and the father of three children. He's currently a driver in a private school. Besides, he runs a hardware store where he sells construction materials. With this loan, he wants to bolster his working capital.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his working capital

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru: Алимходжаев  Саттор  1965 год рождения ,  женат,  имеет 3 детей.  Вместе  с  женой  Азимовой  Насибой  открыл  возле  дома  маленький  продуктовый  магазинчик.  Два  раза  в  неделю  он  ездит  за  товаром  в  г. Худжанд.  Сначала  у  него  был  небольшой  капитал.  Недавно  он  узнал  про  «Микроинвест»  и  решил  у  нас  кредитоваться.  Таким  образом  он  расширил  свой  товарооборот  и  увеличил  ассортимент  продуктов.
texts.en:
Sattor A. was born in 1956, married and has three children. Together with his wife Nosiboy Azimova he has opened a small grocery store near his house. Two times a week he travels for merchandise to the town of Khujand. At first he had small capital. Just recently has has found out about MicroInvest and decided to take out a loan. This way he has increased his inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Arcoiris Group 1

texts.en:
Teofila P., pictured on the right, is the coordinator of her 5-member group. She resides in Carlo Alvares, a small town in the sector of Villa Mella, part of Santo Domingo Norte. She lives with her husband and four children: two girls ages 18 and 13, and two boys ages 9 and 6. The oldest girl currently studies tourism in college. Teofila works hard so all of her children can attend school. She currently operates a "san" business. This is a business where people order a product from her, and then pay her weekly or monthly. Once they have paid enough for the item, she buys it and delivers it to them.

Teofila plans to use this loan in order to stock up on the items with the greatest demand, such as pressure cookers, cooking wear, and sandals. By buying them before they have been ordered, she can purchase them in bulk at lower prices and proviD. faster service. As a result, she will be able to handle more customers investing in her "san," and increase her flow of income. With the increased income, she hopes to be able to afford a technology course for her 13-year-old and take beauty classes.

Some of Teofila's long term goals are to place all four of her children through college and to improve her current living situation.

loans.use: Pressure cookers, cooking wear, and sandals.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, trabaja como seguridad física y tiene una pensión donde atiende cenas de lunes a domingo, es una forma de poder solventarse todos los gastos además que le ayuda a su madre con la alimentación.
Vive en la Zona de obrajes de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado la compra de insumos (Arroz, fideo, aceite, verduras y carne) para su negocio de venta de comida..
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Israel works as a security guard and also operates a boarding house where he serves dinner Monday through Sunday. This enables him to pay all of his expenses and also help his mother with the food bill. He lives with his parents in the Obrajes district of the city of La Paz.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies (rice, noodles, oil, vegetables and meat) for his food business. This is his third loan with IMPRO. His payment history qualifies him as a good client capable of making his installments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his food business

loans.name: Channarin

texts.en: Mrs. Channarin K. is a villager in Thy Chrab village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 35 year old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. She wants to expand her second child’s business. Thus, Mrs. Channarin K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to earn more profits for her child.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to earn more profits for her child.

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Taina is the group coordinator for the Joyas para Cristo (Jewels for Christ), for a Banco De Esperanza (Bank of Hope) located in the slums of northern Santo Domingo where electricity and water (none of which is potable) is unreliable. She lives in a small house, which she shares with 5 other people.

She supports herself with a small business making and selling silver jewelry and furniture coverings. She is using this loan to further expand her business towards her goal of having her own store dedicated to interior design. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for making furniture coverings and Jewelry.

loans.name: Elda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Como toda mujer nicaragüense, la señora Elda del Socorro M. se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su hogar y ella lo realiza por medio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas las que prepara con sus propias manos en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito oportuno para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz y así preparar las deliciosas tortillas para venderlas.
texts.en:
Like all Nicaraguan women, Sra. Elda del Socorro M. strives to support her household. She carries this out by making and selling tortillas, which she prepares with her own hands from the wholesale market in Managua.

She has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn, for preparing delicious tortillas to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn T. is from the village of Unidos. She is 45 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services to local community members. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Jovelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Jovelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 49 años D. edad, D. estado civil conviviente, tiene 05 hijos, vive en el Barrio Porteño, estudio educación primaria incompleta (4to grado).
